# [\#62 Issue](https://github.com/typst/biblatex/issues/62) `open`: Consider adding all non-standard BibLaTeX types

#### <img src="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/13004777?u=91ed8a33e27ece00b673da14481080fb939ae6f2&v=4" width="50">[xkevio](https://github.com/xkevio) opened issue at [2024-10-06 18:36](https://github.com/typst/biblatex/issues/62):

See chapter 2.1.3 here: https://mirror.dogado.de/tex-archive/macros/latex/contrib/biblatex/doc/biblatex.pdf.

This could be useful to have as certain entry types currently get mapped to `misc`/`document` which loses a lot of formatting.
Lots of CSL styles can handle these extra types, e.g., the IEEE CSL style has custom rules for `motion_picture` which only LaTeX (presumably through biber or citeproc) correctly maps from the non-standard `@video` type.
